name: Lorie Santos
text: Projects galore: crafting, sewing finishing unfinished paintings, Lego-building, learning how to code. For not-so-producti ve fun: binge-watching series, and playing old PC games like Heroes of Might and Magic (specifically III and IV) and Diablo 2.

source_obj.text: Projects galore: crafting, sewing finishing unfinished paintings, Lego-building, learning how to code. For not-so-producti ve fun: binge-watching series, and playing old PC games like Heroes of Might and Magic (specifically III and IV) and Diablo 2.

replies.text: Lorie Santos  i would recommend Heroes V. It has a good narrative. III became bloated while IV couldn't hook me in. I've probably played it 4 times already.

Jvee Veneracion  Bought Heroes V and tried it a couple of times, but the graphics felt too distracting, with the animations making the battles take so long. But maybe I should revisit it. IV was fun because of the development of the heroes  :) .
Lorie Santos  u can adjust play and animation speed. U can also reduce and turn off individual animation. Major complaint of fans is the design became too anime.
